result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian W. Koebernick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50 + costs = $516 (includes DNA); within 120 days. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 

Submit DNA Sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian W. Koebernick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 11:10 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Brian W. Koebernick in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall: Defendant did appear for DA PTC, ADA Shock left a note that Mr. Koebernick was likely to accept offer
Mr. Koebernick informs the Court that he would like to accept the State's offer, but enter a no contest plea rather than guilty plea
ADA Hall submits criminal case settlement form
Court reviews right to counsel. Mr. Koebernick waives this right; Court accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50 + costs = $516 (includes DNA); within 120 days. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Submit DNA Sample
Recess: 11:36 am
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:11am. 
Defendant Brian W. Koebernick in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Mr. Koebernick makes a statement about the inconsistent statements that were given by the parties involved.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court continued the $150 cash bond (already posted) with added conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Danielle Bruni
recess 11:15am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/2/15 at 10:20am   (2)  Status Conference on 9/11/15 at 11:00am.
